metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9226 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Oniguruma 6.2.0, as used in Oniguruma-mod in Ruby through 2.4.1 and mbstring in PHP through 7.1.5. A heap out-of-bounds write or read occurs in next_state_val() during regular expression compilation. Octal numbers larger than 0xff are not handled correctly in fetch_token() and fetch_token_in_cc(). A malformed regular expression containing an octal number in the form of '\700' would produce an invalid code point value larger than 0xff in next_state_val(), resulting in an out-of-bounds write memory corruption. It was discovered that Oniguruma incorrectly handled certain regular expressions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information, cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libonig4 - 6.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libonig package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-1').
